Pre-Game Insights: Senegal will head into Monday's clash seeking to secure their first win of the qualifiers.
Burundi will look to pick up where they left off against Malawi.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burundi have now gone four consecutive games without defeat, picking up two wins and two draws — a run that has seen them rise to third place in Group F of the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers.
Senegal have now failed to win three of their last four competitive matches — losing once and claiming two draws — with a 1-0 victory over Mauritania on June 9 being the exception.
Others: Burundi and Senegal return to action in Group L of the Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers when they square off at the Bingu National Stadium on Monday.
Burundi turned in a resilient team display in last Thursday’s Group L curtain-raiser as they secured a 3-2 victory over Malawi at the Bingu National Stadium.
